Review and Appreciate: If you followed through with an important task yesterday, give yourself credit for
  taking the challenge. That's being on The Path.
quote: "Things work out best for those who make the best of how things work out." John Wooden

step_of_the_day.title:
Finding ways to be accepting of reality. It will help you feel better about yourself and best support your
  presence and growth (Pillars #7 & 9)
step_of_the_day.content:
Remember, there is always a "best way" to be in this and every moment. And it starts with accepting "what
  is". Acceptance doesn't necessarily mean you like "what is", but it's the acceptance of reality. Any other
  approach to the present moment: "why does it have to be this way?", "I wish this were different", or "I
  should have done this differently/better" - all result in greater upset, stress, and difficulty being
  present and moving forward. It adds friction or resistance to your life's journey, with no benefit.So, as Mr. Wooden suggests, you will get the best results when you make the best of how things work out, or
  how things are - in this and every moment."The more you accept each moment, the more you can be present each moment" Stephen Sideroff

action_step:
Today, notice your tendency to wish things were different, or to be upset with how they are. When you notice
  this, shift into a place of acceptance. And then focus on how to make the best of how things are.
journal_entry: Write about your relationship with acceptance.
